etymologies: Old English rōther ‘paddle, oar’, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch roer, German Ruder, also to the verb row

definitions: a flat piece hinged vertically near the stern of a boat or ship for steering.
shortDefinitions: flat piece near stern of boat for steering

definitions: a vertical airfoil pivoted from the horizontal stabilizer of an aircraft, for controlling movement around the vertical axis.
shortDefinitions: vertical aerofoil pivoted from tailplane of aircraft

definitions: application of a rudder in steering a boat, ship, or aircraft

examples.text: bring the aircraft to a stall and apply full rudder
a small amount of extra rudder

shortDefinitions: application of rudder in steering boat or aircraft
